explains: n. 精通外国语言的人；语言学家

sentences.en: As a linguist once said, "You can get people to think it's nonsense at the same time that you buy into it. “
sentences.cn: 正如一位语言学家曾经说过的那样：“你可以让人们认为它是无稽之谈，但同时你又对它深信不疑。”

sentences.en: Cummings boldly experimented with this principle, and he attracted the attention of the linguists, particularly a linguist named Dell Hymes.
sentences.cn: 卡明斯大胆地试验了这一原则，他吸引了语言学家的注意，尤其是一位名叫戴尔·海姆斯的语言学家。

sentences.en: Benjamin Lee Whorf, an American linguist who died in 1941, held that each language encodes a worldview that significantly influences its speakers.
sentences.cn: 1941年去世的美国语言学家本杰明·李·沃尔夫认为，每种语言都蕴含着一种世界观，这种世界观会对使用者产生重大影响。
